name: sonos-http-api
description: Modern, fast HTTP API for Sonos speakers with Alexa skill compatibility
author: Shane Hartman <shartman@nx.bogometer.com> and Claude (Anthropic)

scripts.dev: NODE_OPTIONS="--openssl-legacy-provider" LOG_LEVEL=debug DEBUG_CATEGORIES=all dotenv -- tsx watch src/server.ts
scripts.dev:log: NODE_OPTIONS="--openssl-legacy-provider" LOG_LEVEL=debug DEBUG_CATEGORIES=all dotenv -- tsx watch src/server.ts 2>&1 | tee logs/server.log
scripts.test: npm run build && NODE_OPTIONS="--openssl-legacy-provider" tsx test/run-tests.ts
scripts.test:log: npm run build && bash -c 'NODE_OPTIONS="--openssl-legacy-provider" tsx test/run-tests.ts "$@" 2>&1 | tee logs/test-output.log' --
scripts.test:unit: npm run build && NODE_OPTIONS="--openssl-legacy-provider" tsx test/run-tests.ts -- --mock-only
scripts.test:integration: npm run build && NODE_OPTIONS="--openssl-legacy-provider" tsx test/run-tests.ts -- integration/**/*-tests.ts
scripts.test:playback: npm run build && NODE_OPTIONS="--openssl-legacy-provider" tsx test/run-tests.ts -- unit/playback-tests.ts integration/playback-tests.ts
scripts.test:volume: npm run build && NODE_OPTIONS="--openssl-legacy-provider" tsx test/run-tests.ts -- unit/volume-tests.ts
scripts.test:groups: npm run build && NODE_OPTIONS="--openssl-legacy-provider" tsx test/run-tests.ts -- integration/group-tests.ts
scripts.test:coverage: npm run build && NODE_OPTIONS="--openssl-legacy-provider" tsx test/check-coverage.ts
scripts.killall: pkill -f 'node.*dist/server.js' || pkill -f 'tsx.*src/server.ts' || pkill -f 'tsx watch' || lsof -ti:5005 | xargs kill -9 || true
scripts.version: node -p "const v = require('./package.json').version.split('.'); console.log(JSON.stringify({version: require('./package.json').version, major: parseInt(v[0]), minor: parseInt(v[1]), patch: parseInt(v[2])})); ''"
scripts.version:save: node -e "const v = require('./package.json').version.split('.'); const versionObj = {version: require('./package.json').version, major: parseInt(v[0]), minor: parseInt(v[1]), patch: parseInt(v[2])}; require('fs').writeFileSync('src/version.ts', 'export const applicationVersion = ' + JSON.stringify(versionObj, null, 2) + ';\n');"
